summary: Mitchell Livingston Werbell III is an individual who appears in CIA and FBI records primarily in the early 1970s. The documents suggest he had some form of contact with the CIA, although the exact nature is not specified. He faced legal troubles, including the revocation of his Department of Defense security clearance and an indictment on drug charges. The CIA was concerned about his potential to reveal classified information or agency connections. The FBI investigated him as part of a broader inquiry into alleged CIA activities.
significance: The provided documents do not explicitly link Mitchell Livingston Werbell III to the JFK assassination. His significance lies in his connections to the CIA and his legal issues, which raised concerns within the agency about potential disclosures of classified information. The documents suggest he was a person of interest to both the CIA and FBI during the early 1970s.
